body:
Hey everyone. Once again I'd like to start another discussion in order to gain feedback from the community on different important topics. These discussions are becoming very important when we (the senior staff team) look to design and execute new ways to improve upon the server and its community. 

Today's Topic:-

What do you feel able the current communication between yourself and the staff/senior staff team?

Do you feel it is effective enough, or do you feel it could be greatly improved on?
body_tagged:
Hey everyone. Once again I'd like to start another discussion in order to gain feedback from the community on different important topics. These discussions are becoming very important when we (the senior staff team) look to design and execute new ways to improve upon the server and its community. 

Today's Topic:-

What do you feel able the current communication between yourself and the staff/senior staff team?

Do you feel it is effective enough, or do you feel it could be greatly improved on?
title: Discussion #3:  STAFF -> PLAYER Communication

replies.body: Its perfect.
replies.body_tagged: Its perfect.

replies.body:
I think that it is quite efficient the way that it is.

Because the Sr. staff members all have Skype, it is easy to communicate with them.

If they also had individual emails, it would be even easier, such as "jozzmcozz@avicus.net" or something of that same basic principle, but it does truly cost a lot more, so Skype will have to be the easiest way of communication.

replies.body: The communication is the only bad thing about the moderators (not all just some of them) they need to warn somebody in chat before kicking them or giving a warn because most of the time it's just a missunderstanding, a lot of people gets warned or kicked for hackusation/being mean in chat without any chat warn, for example I get a warn for hackusation when I was just derping with a friend (The Jr.mod didn't ask why did I hackusate and more important why didn't I report) after that everything is perfect with mods, compared to other networks we have the best staff (exceptions can be made)

replies.body:
hmm.. There isnt much i would change, but I think there should be:

More mods (Since this is a pretty big server)
When a mod recieves at least 3 - 4 reports on a player they should check the specific player.
And final... and Most of all important.... Knowing the punishments of the player .-. Im saying this cause some staff kick before warn, Ban before kick, etc. But either than that i think its fine... It could be improved just a little maybe but... What you gonna doe eh?

replies.body:
Moderators should check every report that comes in unless it's invalid. If there's many reports, it's set to a higher priority.
Ex: Someone reported once for "Spamming" is less of a priority than someone reported 5 times for "Fly Hacking."
replies.body_tagged:
Moderators should check every report that comes in unless it's invalid. If there's many reports, it's set to a higher priority.

replies.body:
What do you feel able the current communication between yourself and the staff/senior staff team? I think the mods need to not hide up in the moderator chat all the time and when people poke and ask for help or whatever, that they should answer the pokes. Earlier today I poke 5 staff sitting up there and only 2 poked me back. And none were AFK. 
Do you feel it is effective enough, or do you feel it could be greatly improved on? I think it could GREATLY improve
replies.body_tagged:

Earlier today I poke 5 staff sitting up there and only 2 poked me back. And none were AFK. 
Do you feel it is effective enough, or do you feel it could be greatly improved on? I think it could GREATLY improve

replies.body: It's ok, the staff I don't like retired or were demoted :)

replies.body:
I like the mods, I think communication is as good as it can be for non paid positions. They have lives and are split between many things. Do I have all my questions answered? nope. Do I get a reply in and hour or two? Not most of the time, but it is what it is, and I really don't have anything to complain about. Avicus mods are not employees so any help I get I really do appreciate.

Normally when  I report someone - or someone reports me, they seem to be very quick and respond pretty fast and communicate fast, other ways of communication are hit or miss, but again, I am glad we do get the communication we have. Keep up the good work.
replies.body_tagged:
I like the mods, I think communication is as good as it can be for non paid positions. They have lives and are split between many things. Do I have all my questions answered? nope. Do I get a reply in and hour or two? Not most of the time, but it is what it is, and I really don't have anything to complain about. Avicus mods are not employees so any help I get I really do appreciate.

Normally when  I report someone - or someone reports me, they seem to be very quick and respond pretty fast and communicate fast, other ways of communication are hit or miss, but again, I am glad we do get the communication we have. Keep up the good work.

replies.body: <u></u>Its not Ivy's job to deal with the community, its my job. Please send all questions to me, and I will forward severe issues to Ivy. Feel free to send anything else to any member of the Sr Staff team for the best answer.
replies.body_tagged: <u></u>Its not Ivy's job to deal with the community, its my job. Please send all questions to me, and I will forward severe issues to Ivy. Feel free to send anything else to any member of the Sr Staff team for the best answer.

replies.body: thanks Avi, in the meantime will we be adding a messaging on this forum so that we can msg our friends and any mods? (^_^)?
replies.body_tagged: thanks Avi, in the meantime will we be adding a messaging on this forum so that we can msg our friends and any mods? (^_^)?

replies.body:
When I fisrt came to Avicus, I was very suprised at how laid back the moderators are.
In my opinion this is a good and bad thing.

A good thing because I feel that the moderators are much more approachable compared to other servers. They are very friendly and I love that.

But...

I have always thought the infraction system has been far too lenient towards players. For example, I have seen players with several warnings for the same thing. In my opinion it should be Warn,Kick,Tempban,Permaban.
Not Warn,warn,warn,kick,warn etc.

Not trying to be disrespectful, it's just my two cents.
But still, something to think about? Yes?

The Avicus Network staff is my favourite staff team out of all the servers I play on. Keep up the great work!

:)

:)

replies.body:
I think the staff communications are generally really good, but reporting, I never feel like it exists. A great addition would be if a player you reported got banned, kicked etc. The reporter would get an automatic reply saying something like (report handled), so it feels like reports actually work.
Just a recommendation (And what about that friend button?)

replies.body: The staff are great, I think them being more social creates me to think of them as help and not some police patrolling the server.  At the same time, I'm glad they take the position serious and enforce any rules broken. One thing though is treat everyone fair.  A staff may know one person and not know the other.  They should make sure your not to feel exclusive to anyone.  If someone joins the server they should feel welcome and know the staff has their back.

One thing though is treat everyone fair.  A staff may know one person and not know the other.  They should make sure your not to feel exclusive to anyone.  If someone joins the server they should feel welcome and know the staff has their back.

replies.body: We need more devs :D

replies.body:
One thing that has always bugged me is the Map Rotation, and how it's managed. More specifically, I'd like to know what maps are in the Rots, and what maps aren't. While I do know that there's the MD Thread, it just feels like it doesn't work for me, mainly because I have to follow a trail of "which maps got removed in this update, which maps got added back in this other update, etc., etc.,"

What I'd suggest is having a main thread, (preferably stickied), with a list of the current Map Rots. It be a bit of a hassle for the Map Devs, but I do feel that the extra work would help regular players immensely when trying to follow the maps.
replies.body_tagged:
One thing that has always bugged me is the Map Rotation, and how it's managed. More specifically, I'd like to know what maps are in the Rots, and what maps aren't. While I do know that there's the MD Thread, it just feels like it doesn't work for me, mainly because I have to follow a trail of "which maps got removed in this update, which maps got added back in this other update, etc., etc.,"

What I'd suggest is having a main thread, (preferably stickied), with a list of the current Map Rots. It be a bit of a hassle for the Map Devs, but I do feel that the extra work would help regular players immensely when trying to follow the maps.

replies.body: It's very good! This can be approved maybe trough a section in the "Administration" called "Staff Questions". There you can post Questions about other players or just staff related Questions. It would be like the "Player Report" section (only staff and the thread creator can see the thread). This would be useful, if you want the opinions, advises or answers from the staff members. Also if you have any consults related to the thread. I know skype can be used for that, but there you have only one person answering and if they don't know the answer you have to contact another staffmember. Same with the Emails. So I would like to see the new section.

replies.body: We had this a while back it was called Ask the Staff and it was public for all players to reply. If we dont do this you can always either email support for questions of post a topic in Avicus Help http://avicus.net/forums?topic_id=34 and you will more than likely get a reply from an able staff member. ^_^
